definitions.definition: Something used to add taste or flavour to food, such as salt and pepper or other condiment, herb or spice.
(by extension) Anything added to increase enjoyment.
A coat of polymerized oil inside a cooking vessel which renders the surface non-stick.

definitions.example: Some of our gentlemen officers, happening to stop at a tavern, or rather a sort of grogshop, took such a seasoning that two or three of them became “quite frisky.”

definitions.definition: In diamond-cutting, the charging of the laps or wheels with diamond dust and oil.
To make fit for any use by time or habit; to habituate; to accustom; to inure.
definitions.example: to season oneself to a climate

definitions.definition: (by extension) To prepare by drying or hardening, or removal of natural juices.
definitions.example: The timber needs to be seasoned.

definitions.definition: To become mature; to grow fit for use; to become adapted to a climate.
To become dry and hard, by the escape of the natural juices, or by being penetrated with other substance.
definitions.example: The wood has seasoned in the sun.

definitions.definition: To mingle: to moderate, temper, or qualify by admixture.
To flavour food with spices, herbs or salt.
